title: Mushroom Stroganoff
description: A creamy, savory vegetarian take on the classic stroganoff featuring a medley of mushrooms simmered with onions, garlic, and a tangy mustard-sour cream sauce. Ready in under an hour, it’s rich, comforting, and perfect served over egg noodles, rice, or mashed potatoes.

ingredients.display_name: mixed mushrooms (cremini, shiitake, button), cleaned and sliced
ingredients.notes: slice larger mushrooms to similar thickness
or use all olive oil for dairy-free (modification)
use in combination with butter to prevent burning
for thickening; use gluten-free flour if needed
temper before adding to avoid curdling
use vegetarian Worcestershire if strictly vegetarian
adjust to taste; plus more for pasta water if applicable

ingredients.display_name: egg noodles (or pasta/rice of choice), cooked according to package directions

steps.text: Prepare ingredients: clean and slice mushrooms, finely chop onion, mince garlic, measure liquids and spices, and start water for pasta if using; keep sour cream at room temperature.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and add butter and olive oil until shimmering. Add sliced mushrooms in a single layer and cook without stirring for 3 minutes to encourage browning, then stir and continue cooking until golden and reduced, about 6–8 minutes total for mushrooms.
Push mushrooms to the side of the pan, add chopped onion and cook over medium heat until softened and translucent, about 4 minutes. Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Sprinkle flour over the mushrooms and onions and cook, stirring, for 1 minute to remove the raw flour taste and form a light roux.
Gradually pour in the warm vegetable broth while stirring to deglaze the pan and dissolve the roux. Bring the mixture to a gentle simmer and cook until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes.

Reduce heat to low. In a small bowl, whisk together sour cream, Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, smoked paprika, and lemon juice. Temper the sour cream mixture by adding a few tablespoons of the hot broth from the pan while whisking, then stir the tempered mixture back into the skillet. Warm through gently; do not boil.
Season the stroganoff with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. If sauce is too thick, loosen with a splash of broth. Simmer on low for 2 minutes to marry flavors.
Serve the mushroom stroganoff over cooked egg noodles (or rice/mashed potatoes), garnish with chopped parsley and an extra grind of black pepper.
